Toothbrush with a built-in timer: A toothbrush with a built-in timer would help individuals brush their teeth for the full recommended 2 minutes. The timer could be set to beep or vibrate after the full 2 minutes, encouraging people to brush for the full duration.

Toothbrush with a tongue scraper: A toothbrush with a tongue scraper would make it easier for individuals to clean their tongues, which is an important part of oral hygiene. The tongue scraper could be attached to the back of the toothbrush handle or integrated into the bristles.

Toothbrush with a built-in tongue cleaning feature: A toothbrush with a built-in tongue cleaning feature would allow individuals to clean their tongues without needing a separate tongue scraper. The feature could involve a small brush or bristles on the back of the toothbrush handle that rotate or move to clean the tongue.

Toothbrush with a personalized bristle shape: A toothbrush with personalized bristles could provide a more comfortable and effective cleaning experience. The bristles could be designed to be softer or firmer depending on an individual's preference, and they could also be shaped to reach specific areas of the mouth more effectively.

Toothbrush with a built-in water flosser: A toothbrush with a built-in water flosser would provide an additional way to clean between teeth and below the gumline. The water flosser could be activated by pressing a button on the handle or by using a foot pedal. This would make it easier for individuals to maintain good oral hygiene, especially those who have difficulty using traditional flossing tools.
